"'Transmission'" is a song by post-punk band Joy Division, released on Factory
Records in November 1979 on 7" and re-released as a 12" single with a different
sleeve in December 1980.

The single charted twice in New Zealand, debuting at number two in September
1981, and re-appearing again at number 24 in July 1984.

In May 2007, [[NME]] magazine placed "Transmission" at number 20 in its list of
the 50 Greatest Indie Anthems Ever, [http://www.nme.com/news/nme/28059 The
Greatest Indie Anthems Ever], NME (accessed January 8, 2009). one place
below "Love Will Tear Us Apart".

It was played on-stage in the film [[24 Hour Party People]], a scene in which
Ian Curtis suffers an epileptic fit.

It has been covered by Low (on its EP [[Transmission (EP)|Transmission]]),
Bauhaus (as well as by frontman Peter Murphy on his solo tours) and
Innerpartysystem, and Girl in a Coma. A version by Hot Chip is on the War Child
charity album, [[Heroes (2009 album)|Heroes]], released in February
2009. Adam Woods,
[http://www.musicweek.com/story.asp?sectioncode=1&storycode=1035748&c=1 Humbling
response delays Heroes], [[Music Week]] (accessed January 8, 2009). It was
also covered by the cast of Control, a biographical film about the life of Ian
Curtis. Andy Kellman, [http://www.allmusic.com/album/control-original-soundtrack-
mw0000486129 Control - Original Soundtrack] (accessed February 1st, 2013).

It was also played by The Smashing Pumpkins on the [[Adore (The Smashing
Pumpkins album)|Adore]] Tour in 1998, with performances of the song usually
lasting from 15 to 25 minutes. SPFC.com,
[http://www.spfc.org/tours/date.html?tour_id=608 1998 Tour Dates], (accessed
August 16, 2009).
